definition: tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable

sentences.english: Rattling around like four peas in a pod.
sentences.chinese: 我們就像被夾在豆莢裏的四顆豆子，飄搖不定。

sentences.english: In Virginia, 19, 000 jobs are at risk.
sentences.chinese: 在維吉尼亞，有19000個工作崗位在風雨中飄搖。

sentences.english: The tottering cause of Sichuan Opera seems to have successors.
sentences.chinese: 風雨飄搖中的川劇事業似乎後繼有人。

sentences.english: In the stormy days, storms will steal my pain.
sentences.chinese: 在風雨飄搖的日子，風暴將竊取我的痛苦。

sentences.english: The music of the far-away summer flutters around the autumn seeking its former nest.
sentences.chinese: 逝去了的夏之曲，飄搖在秋間，尋求它舊日的巢。

sentences.english: Icried aloud and waved the linen of my turban.
sentences.chinese: 我就大聲叫喊着又將我頭巾的竹布飄搖着。

sentences.english: In the evening let me carry thy lamp through the stormy path.
sentences.chinese: 在黃昏的時候，讓我拿着您的燈走過風雨飄搖的道路。

sentences.english: The music of the far-away summer flutters around autumn seeking its former nest.
sentences.chinese: 逝去了的夏之曲，飄搖在秋間，尋求它舊日的巢。

sentences.english: Night Lanshan, you can not see the end of the way, despite a heart, the yearning in Piaoyao.
sentences.chinese: 處，終看不見你的樣子，任憑一顆心，在思念裏飄搖。

sentences.english: The lily lolls upon the wave;
Hearing a flower sweet, treat the new branch that sways outside shake window, the dream is in his place.
sentences.chinese: 聞着花香，看飄搖窗外搖曳的新枝，夢在自己的地方。

sentences.english: But police makes to the blow of pilfer edition the career swaying in the midst of a raging storm of this group of youths.
sentences.chinese: 但警方對盜版的打擊使這羣年輕人的事業風雨飄搖。

sentences.english: It is anti-traditional created a wave of precarious tradition.
sentences.chinese: 正是反傳統的浪潮造就了風雨飄搖的傳統。

sentences.english: By the river, willows grew bright.
sentences.chinese: 大江旁，勃勃柳樹在飄搖。

definition: wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
homeless and miserable/forced to leave home and wander from place to place/to live as a refugee
the world of mortals (Buddhism)/human society/worldly affairs
